title: Media Appeal Tribunal a step too far - Press Council Appeals Panel
text:
Johannesburg - The establishment of a Media Appeals Tribunal may be too drastic, the Press Council Appeals Panel said on Friday.
Chairperson of the panel, Judge Bernard Makgabo, said an appeals tribunal could take the country down a "slippery path".
"Political leaders have a right to complain about the way they are represented, but a Media Appeals Tribunal, in whatever way it [is] projected, feels like we are going one step too far," said Makgobo.
He was addressing a briefing in Johannesburg where he said he believed journalists and political leaders all respected the rights to freedom of expression.
